page.title: 03Railways - Branch lines
page.content: The main line from Taunton to Exeter had two branches in the 19th Century, both leaving from Norton Fitzwarren station - now owned by Taunton Cider. The West Somerset Railway opened in 1862 to Watchet and extended to Minehead in 1874. The Devon and Somerset line to Barnstaple was built cheaply with only three crossing loops in 43 mls of single track. Both lines fell under Dr. Beeching's axe in 1964 although in 1974 the West Somerset Railway was reopened privately from Bishops Lydeard north. Future plans include control of signal boxes and crossings from Exeter computers in 1986.
